Rule.Name: Ensure journald ForwardToSyslog is disabled (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Log forwarding is enabled (or not explicitly disabled).
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set ForwardToSyslog=no.
Rule.Correction: systemctl unmask systemd-journald.service && systemctl start systemd-journald.service
Rule.Verification: s=$(systemctl is-enabled systemd-journald.service 2>/dev/null); a=$(systemctl is-active systemd-journald.service 2>/dev/null); { [ "$s" = "static" ] || [ "$s" = "enabled" ]; } && [ "$a" = "active" ] && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure journald Compress is enabled (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Log compression is not enabled.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set Compress=yes.
Rule.Correction: find /var/log/journal /run/log/journal -type f -exec chmod 0640 {} + && find /var/log/journal /run/log/journal -type d -exec chmod 0755 {} +
Rule.Verification: bad=0; for f in $(find /var/log/journal /run/log/journal -type f 2>/dev/null); do [ "$(stat -c '%a' "$f")" -le 640 ] || { echo "Bad file: $f"; bad=1; }; done; for d in $(find /var/log/journal /run/log/journal -type d 2>/dev/null); do mode=$(stat -c '%a' "$d"); [[ "$mode" == 755 || "$mode" == 2755 ]] || { echo "Bad dir: $d ($mode)"; bad=1; }; done; [ "$bad" -eq 0 ] && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure journald Storage is persistent (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The log storage mode is not persistent.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set Storage=persistent.

Rule.Name: Ensure only one logging system is in use (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Multiple logging systems (rsyslog and journald) are active simultaneously.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure only one logging system is active (either journald or rsyslog).
Rule.Correction: systemctl stop rsyslog && systemctl disable rsyslog && systemctl restart systemd-journald
Rule.Verification: (systemctl is-active --quiet rsyslog && ! systemctl is-active --quiet systemd-journald) || (! systemctl is-active --quiet rsyslog && systemctl is-active --quiet systemd-journald) && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure systemd-journal-remote is installed (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: systemd-journal-remote is not installed.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install systemd-journal-remote using apt.

Rule.Name: Ensure systemd-journal-upload authentication is configured (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Missing or incomplete authentication parameters for journal upload.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set URL, ServerKeyFile, ServerCertificateFile and TrustedCertificateFile in the [Upload] section.
Rule.Correction: grep -q '^URL=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^ServerKeyFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^ServerCertificateFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^TrustedCertificateFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && echo 0 || echo 1
Rule.Verification: grep -q '^URL=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^ServerKeyFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^ServerCertificateFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && grep -q '^TrustedCertificateFile=' /etc/systemd/journal-upload.conf.d/60-journald_upload.conf && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure systemd-journal-upload is enabled and active (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The systemd-journal-upload service is not enabled and/or not running.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable and start the systemd-journal-upload service.
Rule.Correction: systemctl unmask systemd-journal-upload.service && systemctl --now enable systemd-journal-upload.service
Rule.Verification: systemctl is-enabled systemd-journal-upload.service | grep -q enabled && systemctl is-active systemd-journal-upload.service | grep -q active && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure systemd-journal-remote service is not in use (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The system is configured to receive remote logs via systemd-journal-remote.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the system does not act as a log server by masking and stopping the journal-remote services.
Rule.Correction: systemctl stop systemd-journal-remote.socket systemd-journal-remote.service && systemctl mask systemd-journal-remote.socket systemd-journal-remote.service
Rule.Verification: systemctl is-enabled systemd-journal-remote.socket systemd-journal-remote.service | grep -q '^enabled' && echo 1 && exit 1; systemctl is-active systemd-journal-remote.socket systemd-journal-remote.service | grep -q '^active' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.Name: Ensure journald ForwardToSyslog is disabled (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: ForwardToSyslog is not disabled in journald configuration.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set ForwardToSyslog=no to prevent duplication of logs.

Rule.Name: Ensure journald Compress is configured (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Compress setting is not enabled in journald configuration.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set Compress=yes to reduce disk usage from logs.

Rule.Name: Ensure journald Storage is configured (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Storage is not configured to be persistent.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set Storage=persistent to ensure logs are not lost on reboot.

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog is installed (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: rsyslog is not installed.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install rsyslog using your package manager.

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog service is enabled and active (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: rsyslog service is not enabled and active.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable and start rsyslog service.
Rule.Correction: systemctl unmask rsyslog.service; systemctl enable --now rsyslog.service
Rule.Verification: systemctl is-enabled rsyslog.service | grep -q enabled && systemctl is-active rsyslog.service | grep -q active && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure journald is configured to send logs to rsyslog (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: journald does not forward logs to rsyslog.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set ForwardToSyslog=yes in journald configuration.

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog log file creation mode is configured (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: $FileCreateMode is not set or too permissive (greater than 0640).
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set $FileCreateMode to 0640 or more restrictive in rsyslog configuration.

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog logging is configured (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Logging rules are not configured to capture system events.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure rules in rsyslog to log relevant system events to /var/log/*.log files.

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog is configured to send logs to a remote log host (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Logs are not forwarded to a remote log host.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure rsyslog to send logs to a remote server (e.g. loghost.example.com).

Rule.Name: Ensure rsyslog is not configured to receive logs from a remote client (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: System is accepting logs from remote clients.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove directives that enable remote log reception in rsyslog.

Rule.Name: Ensure logrotate is configured (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Logrotate not configured for rsyslog logs.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure logrotate is set up to rotate rsyslog logs properly.
Rule.Correction: cat <<EOF > /etc/logrotate.d/rsyslog /var/log/*.log { daily rotate 7 compress missingok notifempty create 0640 root utmp } EOF

Rule.Name: Ensure access to all logfiles has been configured (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Some log files in /var/log have incorrect ownership or permissions.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set appropriate permissions and ownership for all log files under /var/log.
Rule.Correction: find /var/log -type f \( -perm /0137 -o ! -user root -o ! -group adm \) -exec chmod u-x,g-wx,o-rwx {} \; -exec chown root:adm {} \;
Rule.Verification: find /var/log -type f \( -perm /0137 -o ! -user root -o ! -group adm \) | grep -q . && echo 1 || echo 0
